tit.cmt: ここでは日本食としての「豚カツ」が記事となっているため、Tonkatsu としました。豚カツ→breaded, deep-fried pork cutlet と補足を更に変更しました。

sen.j: 豚カツ（とんかつ）は、ブタ肉に小麦粉、溶き卵、パン粉の順番で衣をつけて油で揚げた料理である。
sen.e: A pork cutlet is a pork dish in which the meat is coated with flour, beaten egg and breadcrumbs in this order, and then deep fried.
A pork cutlet (Tonkatsu) is a dish in which pork is coated with flour, beaten egg and breadcrumbs in that order, and then deep fried.
Tonkatsu is a dish in which pork is coated with flour, beaten egg and breadcrumbs in that order, and then deep fried.
sen.cmt: 豚カツ→Tonkatsu としました。

sen.j: もともとはフランス料理のCôteletteまでルーツを辿ることができるが、日本の「カツレツ」という料理方法は独自に発展したもので、和食と考えるのが一般的である。
sen.e: Its roots originally go back to the Côtelette of French cuisine, but Japan's "pork cutlet" recipe has developed separately and is thus considered as a Japanese dish.
Its roots originally go back to the Côtelette of French cuisine, but Japan's "pork cutlet" recipe has developed separately and is therefore considered a Japanese dish.
Its roots originally go back to the Côtelette of French cuisine, but Japan's 'tonkatsu' recipe has developed separately and is therefore considered a Japanese dish.
sen.cmt: 豚カツ→Tonkatsu としました。

sen.j: 欧米でも日本料理として紹介されている。
sen.e: It is introduced as a Japanese dish in Western countries, too.
It has also been introduced as a Japanese dish in Western countries.
It has also been introduced as a Japanese dish in Western countries.

sen.j: （詳細は「カツレツ」を参照）
sen.e: (For more details, please refer to fried meat)
(For more details, please refer to fried meat)
(For more details, please refer to 'Katsuretsu' (cutlet).
sen.cmt: カツレツ→Katsuretsu (cutlet) としました。

sen.j: 豚カツは広義には西洋料理のカツレツ（カツレツ）と呼ばれる豚肉を使用したフライ料理の一種でもある。
sen.e: The pork cutlet is, in a broad sense, a kind of deep fried dish using pork called a pork cutlet (fried meat) in Western cuisine.
The pork cutlet in Western cuisine is, in a broad sense, a kind of deep fried dish using pork.
Tonkatsu, in a broad sense, is one of the fried dishes that uses pork called cutlets of Western cuisine.
sen.cmt: 翻訳を全体的に変更しました。

sen.j: ポーク・カットレットのスタイルの料理は世界各国でみられる。
sen.e: There are dishes in the style of pork cutlets in various countries around the world.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There are dishes in the style of pork cutlets in various countries around the world.
There are dishes in the style of pork cutlets in various countries around the world.

sen.j: だが、日本の豚カツは箸で食べやすいように細切りしてあることが多く、味噌汁・漬物とともに出されるなど日本料理化している。
sen.e: However, the pork cutlet in Japan has become part of Japanese cuisine: it is often cut into smaller slices to make it easier to eat with chopsticks and is served with miso soup and tsukemono (Japanese pickles).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the pork cutlet in Japan has become part of Japanese cuisine: it is often cut into smaller slices to make it easier to eat with chopsticks and is served with miso soup and tsukemono (Japanese pickles).

However, tonkatsu in Japan has become part of Japanese cuisine: it is often cut into smaller slices to make it easier to eat with chopsticks and is served with miso soup and tsukemono (Japanese pickles).
sen.cmt: 豚カツ→Tonkatsu としました。

sen.j: 豚カツ専門店では「とんかつ」と平仮名表記され、店の雰囲気やメニューも和風であることが一般的である。
sen.e: Restaurants specializing in pork cutlets have signs with "Tonkatsu (pork cutlet)" in Hiragana and their atmosphere and dishes are usually in the Japanese style.
Restaurants specializing in pork cutlets have signs with "Tonkatsu (pork cutlet)" in Hiragana and their atmosphere and dishes are usually in the Japanese style.
Restaurants specializing in tonkatsu have signs with 'Tonkatsu' (pork cutlet) in Hiragana and their atmosphere and dishes are usually in the Japanese style.
sen.cmt: 豚カツ→Tonkatsu としました。

sen.j: ここでは日本を中心に普及している狭義の「豚カツ」についてふれる。
sen.e: Here described is a narrow definition of pork cutlets which have spread in areas centering Japan.
The following is a narrow definition of a pork cutlet, which has spread in areas centering in Japan.
The following is a narrow definition of 'tonkatsu,' which has spread in areas centering in Japan.
sen.cmt: 豚カツ→Tonkatsu としました。

sen.j: ウスターソースをアレンジしたトンカツソース、中濃ソース、塩、醤油などをかけて食べる。
sen.e: They are enjoyed with Tonkatsu Sauce (Japanese Ketchup) made from Worcester sauce, medium thick sauce, salt or soy sauce, etc.
Pork cutlet is often enjoyed with Tonkatsu Sauce (Japanese Ketchup) made from Worcester sauce, moderately thick sauce, salt or soy sauce, etc.
Tonkatsu is often enjoyed with tonkatsu sauce, chuno (moderately thick) sauce (both are made from Worcester sauce), salt or soy sauce, etc.
sen.cmt: 豚カツ→Tonkatsu としました。豚カツソースも中濃ソースもウスターソースを元にしているため、左記のように変更しました。

sen.j: カラシや、レモンが添えられることもある。
sen.e: They are sometimes accompanied by mustard and lemon slices.
It is also sometimes eaten with mustard and lemon slices.

sen.j: 近年は、大根おろしとポン酢をかけて食べる和風と呼ばれるスタイルも人気が高い。
sen.e: Lately, a variety called the Japanese style, which is served with grated daikon radish and ponzu sauce (soy source containing citrus juice), is popular as well.
Lately, a variety called the Japanese style, which is served with grated daikon radish and ponzu sauce (soy sauce containing citrus juice), has gained popularity.
Lately, a variety called the Japanese style, which is served with grated daikon radish and ponzu sauce (soy sauce containing citrus juice), has gained popularity.

sen.j: また、関東圏では単に〝カツ〟と呼ぶ時には、トンカツを指すことが多い。
sen.e: In the Kanto area, when simply called "Katsu," it often means a pork cutlet.
In the Kanto area, when someone simply states "Katsu," it often refers to pork cutlet.
In the Kanto area, when someone simply states "Katsu," it often refers to tonkatsu.
sen.cmt: 豚カツ→Tonkatsu としました。

sen.j: ヒレ肉を用いたものは「ヒレカツ」、ロース肉を用いたものは「ロースカツ」というように使用する肉の部位により呼び名を変えることもある。
sen.e: Names sometimes vary as they are named after the part of meat used: when pork tenderloin is cooked, it is "fillet cutlet" while when pork loin is used, it becomes "loin cutlet."
Names for "katsu" sometimes vary as they are named after the part of meat used: when pork tenderloin is cooked it is called "fillet cutlet", while when pork loin is used, it becomes "loin cutlet."

Names sometimes vary as they are named after the part of meat used; when pork tenderloin is cooked it is called 'hirekatsu' (fillet cutlet), while when pork loin is used, it becomes 'rosukatsu' (loin cutlet).
sen.cmt: ロースカツ、ヒレカツ、それぞれ読みを追加しました。

sen.j: また、薄切りの豚肉を重ねて一枚肉のようにまとめたものも見られる。
sen.e: There is another kind using thin sliced meat put together as if it were one slice of meat.
There is another form of tonkatsu that uses thinly sliced meat put together as if it were one slice of meat.
There is another form of tonkatsu that uses thinly sliced meat put together as if it were one slice of meat.

sen.j: 「カツ」と「勝つ」の語呂合わせで、縁起を担いで食べることがある。
sen.e: A homophone of "Katsu (a pork cutlet)" means "to win," and some people eat cutlets believing in omens.
A homophone of "Katsu (a pork cutlet)" means "to win," and some people eat cutlets believing in omens.
A homophone of 'Katsu' (a pork cutlet) means 'to win,' and some people eat cutlets believing in omens.

sen.j: しかし豚カツは、消化に時間がかかる繊維質な豚肉を、これまた消化に時間のかかる油で揚げた料理のため、試合や受験の直前に食べる料理としてはあまり適していない。
sen.e: However, as the pork cutlet uses fibrous pork which takes time to be digested, and then gets deep fried to make it even harder to be digested, it is not very suitable for eating just before games or examinations.

However, as the pork cutlet is made of fibrous pork which takes time to be digested, and is then deep fried making it even harder to digest, it is not very suitable for eating just before sporting events or examinations.

However, as tonkatsu is made of fibrous pork which takes time to be digested, and is then deep fried making it even harder to digest, it is not very suitable for eating just before sporting events or examinations.
sen.cmt: 豚カツ→Tonkatsu としました。

sen.j: 食べるのならば前日の夕食あたりが望ましいともいわれる。
sen.e: If one dares to eat it, the desirable timing is said to be around dinner the previous day.
If one were to dare eating it, the desirable timing is said to be around dinner the previous day.
If one were to dare eating it, the desirable timing is said to be around dinner the previous day.

sen.j: 豚カツという名前の起源にはいくつかの説がある。
sen.e: There are various theories about the origin of its name.
There are various theories about the origin of the name "Tonkatsu."
There are various theories about the origin of the name "Tonkatsu."

sen.j: 1924年に横浜馬車道にできた勝烈庵が初めに売り出した。
sen.e: One is that Katsuretsu-an, which was established on Yokohama Bashamichi in 1924, started the dish.
One theory states that Katsuretsu-an, which was established on Yokohama Bashamichi in 1924, started the dish.

sen.j: 1929年に宮内省大膳職を退職した島田信二郎が、上野にぽんち軒という洋食店を開きそこで売り出された。

sen.j: 1932年に上野に開業した楽天で売り出された。

Yet another states that Rakuten in Ueno, which opened in 1932, started it.

sen.j: 1933年に浅草にできた喜利八が元祖。

sen.j: 厚さ3～4cm、150gほどの豚肉ロースに、包丁を斜めに入れるようにして筋を切る。
sen.e: Prepare a pork loin cut of three to four centimeter thick weighing about 150 grams, and cut its fibers crosswise with a knife.
Prepare a cut of pork loin that is three to four centimeters thick and weighs about 150 grams, and cut it at a slant with a carving knife.

sen.j: 脂身は好みの量を残して切り落とす。
sen.e: Trim off the excess fat.
Trim off the excess fat.
Trim off the excess fat.

sen.j: 肉叩きで叩き、元の大きさの倍ぐらいに伸びたら、無理をせず丁寧に少しずつ元の形に戻す。
sen.e: Pound the meat with a mallet, and when it becomes twice as large as its original size, carefully shape it back to its original form.
Pound the meat with a mallet, and when it becomes twice as large as its original size, carefully shape it back to its original form.
Pound the meat with a mallet, and when it becomes twice as large as its original size, carefully shape it back to its original form.

sen.j: 肉に塩コショウをふりかけ、小麦粉、溶き卵、パン粉の順につける。
sen.e: Salt and pepper the meat, dredge it with flour, dip it in beaten egg and breadcrumb it.
Salt and pepper the meat, cover it with flour, then dip it in beaten eggs and breadcrumbs separately.
Salt and pepper the meat, cover it with flour, then dip it in beaten eggs and breadcrumbs separately.

sen.j: 小麦粉は余分につけていると衣が剥がれるので手で叩いてよく落とす。
sen.e: Pat the excess flour off well with hands, as too much flour can cause coating to come off.
Pat the excess flour off with your hand, as too much flour can cause the coating to come off.
Pat the excess flour off with your hand, as too much flour can cause the coating to come off.

sen.j: 大きめの鍋を用意し、ラードを120～130℃ぐらい（天麩羅より低く）に熱して揚げる。
sen.e: Heat lard in a large fryer up to around 120 to 130℃ (the temperature should be lower than that for Tempura), and fry the meat.
Heat lard in a large sauce pan up to around 120 to 130℃ (the temperature should be lower than for Tempura), and fry the meat.
Heat lard in a large sauce pan up to around 120 to 130℃ (the temperature should be lower than for Tenpura), and fry the meat.

sen.j: 温度が高すぎると周りだけ固くなって、中まで火が通らない。
sen.e: When the temperature is too high, only the coating gets hard and the meat remains undercooked,
If the temperature is too high, only the coating will harden and the meat will remain undercooked,

sen.cmt: 文末をピリオドに変更しました。

sen.j: また、低すぎると衣にパリッとした食感がなくなる。
sen.e: On the other hand, when the temperature is too low, the coating does not get its crispy texture.
On the other hand, if the temperature is too low, the coating will not have its trademark crispy texture.
On the other hand, if the temperature is too low, the coating will not have its trademark crispy texture.

sen.j: こうした事を防ぐ為、高温の油と低温の油を用意し、最初は高温の油で数秒、そして低温の油でおよそ10分位を目安に揚げると、衣はパリッとした食感で中まで火が通る。
sen.e: To prevent these from happening, prepare two pans with lard at high and low temperatures, fry the meat first at the high temperature for several seconds and fry it next at the lower temperature for about 10 minutes, and it will be completely cooked and will retain a crispy texture.

To prevent this from happening, prepare two pans with lard at high and low temperatures, fry the meat first in the high temperature pan for several seconds, and then fry it in the lower temperature pan for about 10 minutes, by doing so it will be thoroughly cooked and will also retain its crispy texture.

To prevent this from happening, prepare two pans with lard at high and low temperatures, fry the meat first in the high temperature pan for several seconds, and then fry it in the lower temperature pan for about 10 minutes, by doing so it will be thoroughly cooked and will also retain its crispy texture.

sen.j: 豚カツは、その派生料理が多く、さまざまなバリエーションが確認される。

There are plenty of dishes derived from tonkatsu (pork cutlet) and all sorts of variations have been made.
There are plenty of dishes derived from tonkatsu and all sorts of variations have been confirmed.

tit.j: 日本国外の豚カツ・ポークカツレツ
tit.e: Tonkatsu and pork cutlets outside Japan
tit.cmt: 豚カツ→Tonkatsu を追加しました。

sen.j: 大韓民国には日本統治時代に伝わったが、朝鮮語には「ツ」に対応する音がないため「トンカス」（）と呼ばれている。
sen.e: The dish spread to South Korea when the country was under the rule of Japan, and as Korean does not have a similar sound to "tsu," it is called "Tonkasu" there.
The dish spread to South Korea when the country was under Japan's rule, and as the Korean language does not have a similar sound to "tsu," it is called "Tonkasu" there.
The dish spread to South Korea when the country was under Japan's rule, and as the Korean language does not have a similar sound to 'tsu,' it is called 'Tonkasu' there.

sen.j: 現在では韓流ドラマにも登場するポピュラーな料理となっているが、形状的には豚肉を薄く延ばすなどむしろ「ポークカツレツ」に近いものとなっている。
sen.e: At present, it is such a popular dish that it appears in TV dramas but, in terms of shape, the meat is pounded into a thin piece, becoming rather like a pork cutlet in Western Cuisine.
sen.cmt: ポークカツレツと、豚カツを用語だけでは分けられないため、前者に「西洋料理の」という説明を追加しました。
sen.e: At present, it is such a popular dish that it appears in TV dramas but, in terms of shape, the meat is pounded into a thin piece, becoming rather like a pork cutlet in Western Cuisine.
At present, it is such a popular dish that it appears in TV dramas but, in terms of shape, the meat is pounded into a thin piece, becoming rather like a 'pork cutlet' in Western Cuisine.

sen.j: 最近では日本風の肉厚があり、ジューシーな食感のする豚カツもソウル特別市などで見られるようになっている。
sen.e: Recently, Japanese style thicker pork cutlets which give more meat juice in one's mouth started to become common in places like Seoul Special City.
Recently, thicker Japanese style pork cutlets which tend to be juicier started to become common in places like Seoul City.
sen.cmt: Reword. I believe "Seoul Special City" is the same as just "Seoul City"
sen.e: Recently, thicker Japanese style tonkatsu which tend to be juicier started to become common in places like Seoul City.
sen.cmt: 豚カツ→Tonkatsu を追加しました。

sen.j: 一方の「ポーク・カットレット（ポークカツレツ）」は欧米などの家庭や料理店でごく普通に供される料理である。

Meanwhile, in Western countries, pork cutlet is very common at restaurants as well as at home.

sen.j: 豚カツのように豚肉にパン粉をまぶし、油で揚げる形態もあるが、フライパンに少量の油を垂らして焼くものなど多種多様である。
sen.e: Styles of cooking vary considerably: Some are bread crumbed and deep fried like the Japanese style pork cutlet whereas others are fried in a frying pan with a small amount of oil.

sen.e: Styles of preparing pork cutlets vary considerably: Some are covered in bread crumbs and deep fried like the Japanese style pork cutlet, whereas others are fried in a frying pan with a small amount of oil.

Styles of preparing pork cutlets vary considerably: Some are covered in bread crumbs and deep fried like the Japanese style tonkatsu, whereas others are fried in a frying pan with a small amount of oil.

sen.j: 日本では洋風に仕上げた豚カツのことを「ポークカツレツ」とし、和食化したものと区別する場合もある。
sen.e: In Japan, sometimes, pork cutlets in the Western style are called "Poku Katsuretsu," distinguishing them from the Japanized ones.

sen.j: 海外の日本料理店には豚カツやカツ丼が置かれている場合も少なくない。
sen.e: Not a few Japanese restaurants overseas have pork cutlets and pork cutlets on rice on the menu,

sen.e: Few Japanese restaurants overseas have pork cutlets and pork cutlets on rice on the menu,
Quite a few Japanese restaurants overseas have tonkatsu and katsudon on the menu.
sen.cmt: 「少なくない」→quite a few restaurants としました。

sen.j: しかし、日本料理店以外でポークカツレツを注文した場合、日本の豚カツとは似ていない料理が供されることが多い。
sen.e: Meanwhile, if one orders a pork cutlet in restaurants other than Japanese ones, the dish will be something very much different from the Japanese style pork cutlet.

sen.j: 中国料理では「排骨」と呼ばれる調理法で作られたポークカツレツが普及していて、日本のラーメン店や中国料理店でもよく見かける。
sen.e: In Chinese cuisine, pork cutlets cooked in culinary art called "Paiku (Pork Ribs)" are common and they can also be found in ramen restaurants and Chinese restaurants in Japan.
